intro: Lomaria triquetra, commonly known as the three-angled lomaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The leaves are typically narrow and have a distinctive three-angled cross-section, which gives the plant its common name. It is native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere and often grows in moist, shaded environments. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
